messages: f61b74c8dee50cf02978ee1e1de8535b (20:48): what is this channel?

f61b74c8dee50cf02978ee1e1de8535b (20:49): iti s related to HTML? (I am seeking someone, or a channel to seek someone, to set-up a video player that supports expanding itself to native resolution, without javascript or flash hackery...)
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:07): f61b74c8dee50cf02978ee1e1de8535b: whatwg is working group working on html5 spec
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:07): f61b74c8dee50cf02978ee1e1de8535b: there won't be such a video player so you can stop searching
f61b74c8dee50cf02978ee1e1de8535b (21:07): that is not w3c ?
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:07): f61b74c8dee50cf02978ee1e1de8535b: see topic
f61b74c8dee50cf02978ee1e1de8535b (21:07): Moo^_^ and WITH javascript, posible?
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:08): f61b74c8dee50cf02978ee1e1de8535b: only for very latest browsers support html5 <video>
f61b74c8dee50cf02978ee1e1de8535b (21:08): Moo^_^: I know that
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:08): f61b74c8dee50cf02978ee1e1de8535b: let's say "it will be better in the future if you don't want to use flash"
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:08): f61b74c8dee50cf02978ee1e1de8535b: if you want to support all browsres
f61b74c8dee50cf02978ee1e1de8535b (21:08): Moo^_^ I will add a fallback to youtube :P
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:08): the tube is yours
216041d316e6b13b3adc506b896b75cd (21:14): f61b74c8dee50cf02978ee1e1de8535b: if you want the W3C HTML WG, the channel is irc://irc.w3.org:6665/html-wg
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:18): man, don't let the w3c hear you say that, they'll have an aneurism :-)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:26): "sh: =: command not found"
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:27): looks like the "=" command is missing on my system
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:27): I guess I should fix that
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:27): I think I'm missing the "." command
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:27): as well
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (21:28): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: Did you put whitespace around it?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:28): I put a return after it
216041d316e6b13b3adc506b896b75cd (21:28): what, no dot command?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:29): I got a deficient shell
216041d316e6b13b3adc506b896b75cd (21:29): command.com?
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (21:29): The first error sounds like vanilla sh
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (21:29): But surely that's extinct by now
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:31): „ÄÇshould do the same thing as .
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:31): that was the problem
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:31): stupid shell
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:31): I prefer to type my dot as a reverve-video do
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:31): and the shell should just understand that
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:31): it should learn all my personal idiosyncracies
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (21:31): Yeah, and should support full-width characters too
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:31): and it should love them
216041d316e6b13b3adc506b896b75cd (21:32): what, and not allowing to make this a *different* command?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:32): kicks his crappy shell
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:32): hey, maybe I will write a new shell
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:32): because clearly we don't have enough of those already
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:32): jackassh
216041d316e6b13b3adc506b896b75cd (21:33): please add whitespace overloading
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (21:34): Maybe make a javascript-based shell
216041d316e6b13b3adc506b896b75cd (21:35): http://www2.research.att.com/~bs/whitespace98.pdf
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (21:38): krijnh: So how's that open sourcing of the logs page going? :)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:51): threads in ruby?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:51): ruby has a thread library?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:52): who thought this was a good idea?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:52): is this some attempt at compensating for poor overall performance?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:53): err, I now see python has threads too
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:53): sign
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:53): of problems elsewhere
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:54): I suppose people really do use it
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:54): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: threads don't work well in python
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:54): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: global interpreter locks allows just on thread to execute python code once
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:54): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: if you are doing IO it is ok
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:54): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: otherwise you do processes
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:54): I see
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:55): why don't people just use C++ or C instead, I wonder
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:55): but oh well
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:55): I mean, for applications that benefit from having lots of threads
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:56): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: I could have many arguments for that but I don't want to start flamewar before I drink the first beer of saturday :)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:57): cheers
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:57): reads about http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Global_Interpreter_Lock
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:57): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: personally I hate it
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:57): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: it prevents creating low resource python web servers
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:58): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: because if you need processes
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:58): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: you go out of mem really fast
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:58): yeah, I would think
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:58): OTOH the set-up is more fault tolerant
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:58): but still
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:58): not good for shared hosting
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:58): low end hosting
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (21:58): for masses
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:59): I thought the world had decided that message passing was the way to go these days
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (21:59): for concurrency and other reasons
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (22:00): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: it's the way of the future :)
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (22:00): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: we haev a lot of legacy to deal with
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (22:00): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: Python also has lots of "tasklet" implementations
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (22:00): or whatever they call them, depending on the implementation
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (22:00): eventlets
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (22:00): the stuff erlang is good at
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (22:01): erlang sets the bar pretty high
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (22:01): the thing with python, ruby et. al. is that you can get open source libaries for them
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (22:02): like "rss reader"
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (22:02): for erlang, you need to build everything by hand
cfb77ecd58f0d637313d4dd81cad6e9c (22:02): so the scope of the use is limited
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (22:02): ah yeah
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (22:02): true
